another perfect example of @chr1sa's longtail effect, working with the physics information tends to converge where the friction is the least (fight that entropy!

SARS spurs ecommerce 1.0 in China, COVID now spurs 2.0 

expecting to see more of 2.0 mobile internet product emerge

the streaming commerce phenomena is a hybrid product of  physical and information highway availability + excessive capacity+ buyers want a more personalized way of shopping + better evaluation of product via stream to offer a high-end customer experience + COVID stuck ppl indoor

@rub3al3xand3r my translation- the physical and information highway enable highly efficient demand/supply matchmaking + longtail effect, information tends to converge where the friction is the least (fight the entropy!) \n\nBitcoin is born like that :) global liquidity and frictionless exchange

farmers many start streaming from their phone and sell fresh produce at the spot\n\nthe mighty logistic network in China makes this possible, now we buy most of our fruits through streaming, in the stream you can see how they pack your fruits and tell them your specific requirement

another supply-side driver is that COVID hits exporters badly, many of them have hard time offloading excess capacity 

so they partner with influencers to co-sell via stream, at close to cost price

for the 1st time, many Chinese can buy high-quality stuff with dirt cheap price

before COVID live stream shopping is more for entertaining/social purpose+ for influencers to cash out clout, but after COVID this quickly become a household thing as folks cant get out and mall are not fully open \n\nfirst time farm to table, factory to house become widely true

offline sales ppl used need to do ton of convincing work in order for you to buy but now it‚Äôs the opposite - buyer side FOMO

In Taobao‚Äôs 2019 stats top influencers can easily sell over 250M yuan in 2 hours, basically $20M GMV per hour per person!!! \n\nAll they do is like my screenshot above, live-streaming to showcase how the product work and have purchase link embedded

The origin of ‚Äústreaming commerce‚Äù \n\nStarting last 2 years, online shopping behavior has seen a huge paradigm shift: from previous in the standard Taobao shop where you interact with CS ppl there, to shop with influencers who showcase items in live streaming

The prerequisite:

There are two kinds of infrastructures Physical highway and information highway

China has been building massive network on both. The physical highway that leads to the very rural areas and internet access covers entire China (now is undergoing 5G upgrade)

RN I‚Äôm watching a ‚Äúlive streaming commerce‚Äù on Taobao with my mom, with over 18 MILLIONS others watching and shopping together 

This ‚Äúonline night market‚Äù phenomena is an amazing by-product of COVID 19 in China
